result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Violation (GPS - Exclusion Zone Violation ) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr. in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Court addressed JusticePoint supervision.  Defense counsel requests bail review hearing regarding GPS monitoring at next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation (GPS - Subsequent Battery Event) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr. in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Adrianna LaMack, Milwaukee Police Department Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation (GPS - Subsequent Battery Event) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Justice Point Violation (GPS - 1st Battery Event) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr. in court.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for State v. Lee Hearing.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Court addressed JusticePoint violations and admonished defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter
Justice Point Violation (GPS - Exclusion Zone Violation) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Justice Point Violation (GPS - Exclusion Zone Violation) Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor Jr. not in court, in custody in HOC.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a status conference. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with DTK (5/29/86).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Kelvin Quentin Taylor in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kelvin Quentin Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br 41.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
